code:
from datetime import datetime

date_object = datetime.strptime('Jun 1 2005  1:33PM', '%b %d %Y %I:%M%p')

childList.text: and a link for the strftime format mask

text: Use the third party dateutil library:

code:
from dateutil import parser
dt = parser.parse("Aug 28 1999 12:00AM")

text: It can handle most date formats, including the one you need to parse.
It's more convenient than strptime as it can guess the correct format most of the time.
Check out strptime in the time module.
It is the inverse of strftime.
